title: Sardar Bukan F.C.
text:
Sardar Bukan or Sardar Bokan, Football Club is an Iranian <a href="association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Bukan">Bokan</a>(Bukan) plays in the Iranian <a href="League%202%20%28Iran%29">League 2</a>.
In 2017, the club became famous for its high attendance despite the club playing in Bukan city and in the third tier. They are one of the best supported teams in the northwest of Iran.
History.
Establishment.
Sardar Bukan was founded in 2000 and began playing in the West Azerbaijan Provincial League. The team's name comes from <a href="Aziz%20Khan%20Mukri">Aziz Khan Mukri</a> who was called "Sardar" and was the head of the <a href="Military%20history%20of%20Iran%23Qajar%20Era%20%281794%20to%201925%29">Iranian Army</a> during the reign of <a href="Naser%20al-Din%20Shah%20Qajar">Naser al-Din Shah Qajar</a>.
Promotions.
They finished as runners up in 2001 and champions in 2002, earning promotion to <a href="League%203%20%28Iran%29">League 3</a>. In 2005 the club started its professional functions, and in 2015 for the first time, the club began to play in <a href="League%202%20%28Iran%29">League 2</a>, which is the Iranian third tier. In the 2016–17 season they barely missed out on promotion to the <a href="Azadegan%20League">Azadegan League</a> (2nd tier).
